description: Calculate the percentage reduction in binding energy of accretor envelopes compared to single stars.
instructions: Using MESA (version 15140) with the same parameters as the paper (Z = 0.0019, initial period P = 100 days, and initial masses (M1, M2) = (18, 15), (20, 17), (38, 30) M☉), calculate the binding energy of the envelopes (BE(m = MHe, αth = 1)) for both accretor and single star models of the same total post-RLOF mass. Calculate the percentage reduction in binding energy for each of the three mass configurations at R = 500 R☉. Return the minimum and maximum percentage reduction values.
output_justification: From the abstract: 'the rejuvenation can lower the energy required to eject a CE by ∼ 42 − 96% for both black hole and neutron star progenitors'. This represents the range across all their models.
